data.description: A course carried with a UW-Madison resident study abroad program that has no equivalent on this campus. Current enrollment in a UW-Madison study abroad program required.
data.title: TOPICS IN PORTUGUESE: STUDY ABROAD

data.description: A survey of representative writing by contemporary Brazillian women writers in relation to representations of nationality, race, class, ethnicity, gender and sexualities.
data.title: BRAZILLIAN WOMEN WRITERS

data.description: Advanced language practice, including intensive writing and work in pertinent areas of grammar and stylistics.
data.title: ADVANCED LANGUAGE PRACTICE

data.description: Advanced survey of Brazilian literature since 1890.
data.title: SURVEY OF BRAZILIAN LITERATURE SINCE 1890

data.description: Advanced survey of Portuguese literature from 1140 to 1825.
data.title: SURVEY OF PORTUGUESE LITERATURE BEFORE 1825

data.description: Advanced survey of Portuguese literature since 1825.
data.title: SURVEY OF PORTUGUESE LITERATURE SINCE 1825

data.description: Chronological and thematic survey of major trends, authors, and works of Lusophone Africa since 1936.
data.title: LUSOPHONE AFRICAN LITERATURE

data.description: Conversation and writing practice, review of grammar, and class reading of a modern Italian novel.
data.title: FOURTH SEMESTER ITALIAN

data.description: Conversational practice, review of grammar, viewing and discussion of Italian films, and class reading of short stories.

data.description: Cultural evolution from the medieval period through the twentieth century. Conducted in English.

data.title: BRAZILIAN CIVILIZATION

data.description: Development of accurate and nuanced capacity for expression in Italian and for understanding the spoken and written language. Also addresses Italian phonetics and phonology to develop accurate pronunciation.
data.title: ADVANCED ITALIAN LANGUAGE

data.description: Introduction to structural similarities and differences apparent in major Romance languages (French, Italian, Portuguese, Spanish) and to their historical developments, with reference to basic linguistic features of each language: phonology, morphology, syntax, and lexicon.

data.description: Introduction to the linguistic sources and the historical and political factors that contributed to the formation of Portuguese and the current status of Portuguese in the world today.
